intro: Oresigonia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in dense clusters, which are typically borne on branched inflorescences. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Oresigonia angustifolia is adapted to arid conditions, with deep roots that allow it to access water from deeper soil layers.
